episodes.natural_language:
Case: Fina-Fatty-MVA-11-05-2024. The client is Fina Fatty, whose date of birth is February 26, 1970. He is insured for health care by United Health Insurance and for auto by Progressive. The incident was a motor vehicle accident that occurred on November 5, 2024, in Sharonville, Ohio (Hamilton County). Sharonville Police Department issued Police Report #242594.

According to the notes, Fina Fatty was driving Vehicle 1, his own vehicle, as part of a run in his semi truck transporting a vehicle; he stated that he is self-employed. He was traveling on Highway 275 in a four-lane corridor, in lane number 2, heading toward Kentucky. Traffic in front of him slowed and stopped; the vehicle behind him (Vehicle 2) was struck from behind by a FedEx truck (Vehicle 3). The impact caused Vehicle 2 to strike Vehicle 1 from the rear, and Vehicle 2 was totaled. There were three vehicles involved altogether. Fina Fatty was the driver of Vehicle 1; a passenger in his vehicle named Salem (the caller notes that Salem is his trainee) was also present. The other driver involved (Vehicle 2) is identified only as an unknown driver, with unknown insurance for that vehicle. Vehicle 3 was a FedEx truck.

Fina Fatty reported injuries of back pain and shoulder pain (both shoulders). He sought medical treatment at the ER, where he received pain medication and underwent X-ray and MRI testing. He had gone to Baptist Hospital in Lexington following the incident for the pain, and has not been seen since the ER visit.

Insurance details note that the caller’s auto insurance is through Progressive, while his health coverage is through United Health Insurance. In the “Additional Information” section, it states that the retainer was not offered because the caller did not meet all criteria: the accident did not occur in Kentucky or Indiana.

The case was referenced in a correspondence from the Whaley Law Firm: Justin Chumbley, Whaley Law Firm, with phone and fax numbers (Ph: 502-583-4022; Fax: 502-364-9363). On January 13, 2025, Aaron Whaley (of Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222) sent a message encouraging the firm to call the client and sign him up, with the option to refer him out if needed. The forwarded message relates to intake completed for Fina Fatty, tagged “The Whaley Law Firm - MVA Intake Completed - Fina Fatty.” The intake indicates:

- New Client - Auto Accident
- Phone Number: +1 859-202-7110
- Email: fattypa249@gmail.com
- Representing party: Myself (Fina Fatty), with no prior legal representation for this matter
- Accident Details: Date of Incident 11/05/2024; Location Sharonville, Ohio (Hamilton County)
- Description: Fina Fatty, a driver, traveling on Highway 275 in lane #2 of a four-lane road when traffic stopped ahead; Vehicle 2 behind him was struck by a FedEx truck (Vehicle 3), causing Vehicle 2 to rear-end Vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 was totaled.
- Involved Parties: Vehicle 1 – Fina Fatty (Driver), insured by Progressive; Passenger – Salem (trainee). Vehicle 2 – Unknown Driver (unknown insurance). Vehicle 3 – FedEx truck.
- Additional Information: The retainer was not offered because the accident did not occur in Kentucky or Indiana. The intake note from January 13, 2025, at 10:05 a.m. indicates the caller wanted to speak with an attorney regarding the auto accident.
- Call Center Notes: Delilah (Call Center Agent). The message was logged by Blazeo Voice Team (support@blazeo.com; Phone: (925) 505-4505).

A subsequent internal communication from January 13, 2025, at 10:52 a.m. from Aaron Whaley urged signing up the client and stated that they could refer him out if necessary. The Whaley Law Firm contact details included Justin Chumbley and the firm’s phone and fax numbers, along with the reiteration of the intake information described above.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Fina-Fatty-MVA-11-05-2024
Client: Fina Fatty

This case involves Fina Fatty, who was injured in a multi-vehicle accident on November 5, 2024, in Sharonville, Ohio. Fina was driving a semi-truck when a FedEx truck hit the vehicle behind him, causing that vehicle to collide with Fina's truck.
The most recent activity shows that medical record and bill requests were sent to Central Emergency Physicians and Radiology Associates via ChartSwap on January 17, 2025. There were some issues with the request for Central Emergency Physicians, which required resubmission with additional information. (See details)
A potential red flag is that the accident occurred in Ohio, which may complicate jurisdiction issues as the law firm appears to be based in Kentucky. Additionally, Fina was working as a contractor at the time of the accident but did not file a workers' compensation claim. (See details)
Next steps should include following up on the medical record requests, particularly for Central Emergency Physicians, and obtaining a complete list of all medical providers Fina has seen since the accident. It's also important to clarify Fina's insurance situation, as there seems to be confusion about whether he has Progressive or United Financial insurance. (See details), (See details)
episodes.natural_language:
This case involves client Fina Fatty, who sustained injuries in a multi-vehicle motor vehicle accident on November 5, 2024, in Sharonville, Ohio. At the time, Fina was driving a semi-truck when a FedEx truck struck the vehicle behind him, causing that vehicle to collide with Fina's truck.

As of January 17, 2025, medical records and bills were requested for Central Emergency Physicians and Radiology Associates via ChartSwap. The request for Central Emergency Physicians encountered issues and required resubmission with additional information.

A potential red flag is that the accident occurred in Ohio, which may complicate jurisdiction issues since the law firm appears to be based in Kentucky. Additionally, Fina was working as a contractor at the time of the accident but did not file a workers' compensation claim.

Next steps include following up on the medical record requests, particularly for Central Emergency Physicians, and obtaining a complete list of all medical providers Fina has seen since the accident. It is also important to clarify Fina's insurance situation, as there seems to be confusion about whether he has Progressive or United Financial insurance.
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

episodes.natural_language:
This note documents the Liberty Mutual motor-vehicle accident case for client Fina Fatty, filed as Fina-Fatty-MVA-11-05-2024, with claim number 058373025-06 (exposure 06). The policy is underwritten by Liberty Mutual Personal Insurance Company. The communications involved Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm and Sarah Mackay, a Casualty Claims Resolution Specialist II at Liberty Mutual. The email traffic includes standard policy and confidentiality language, along with the typical Liberty Mutual contact details and mailing addresses.

On January 14, 2025, Jessa Galosmo sent an external email to Sarah Mackay, attaching a letter of representation for Fina Fatty in response to the claim referenced as 058373025. The note shows Jessa’s signature block with Whaley Law Firm’s contact information. The message’s subject line indicated it was an external communication regarding claim 058373025-06.

On January 23, 2025, Sarah Mackay replied as the assigned bodily injury adjuster. She stated that she had mailed an acknowledgement letter to Jessa’s office and that the claim had liability accepted by Liberty Mutual. She noted that Liberty Mutual did not have permission from their insured to disclose the policy limits and requested an update on Fina’s injury and treatment, as well as whether Fina is eligible for Medicare or Medicaid. This message also contained Liberty Mutual’s standard confidentiality notice and contact details.

On January 24, 2025, Jessa Galosmo responded to Sarah, thanking her for the update and stating that Fina was still undergoing treatment for her injuries. Jessa also noted that Fina was not eligible for Medicare or Medicaid. This email likewise carried the typical confidentiality language and Jessa’s contact information.

On March 17, 2025, there was additional correspondence. At 4:04 PM, Sarah Mackay attempted to reach Jessa by phone to obtain an update on Fina’s injury and treatment. Later that same day, at 4:16:46 PM, Jessa replied: “My apologies for the delayed response. Fina is already done with her treatment.”

Throughout the email thread, the communications include standard policy warnings, such as the confidentiality notice stating that the message and attachments are intended only for the named addressees and may contain privileged information; instructions to notify the sender and delete the message if received in error; and the various Liberty Mutual mailing addresses and contact numbers (Direct Phone: 469-997-3807; Fax: 603-334-8181; business hours; USPS and FedEx/UPS mailing options) and the disclaimer about not disclosing insured limits without authorization. The metadata embedded in the messages identifies the claim number (058373025), exposure number (06), category (Manual Outbound E-Mail), and template (BIFREEFORM).

The chronology begins with an external email dated July 14, 2025, from Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; phone 502-583-4022) to Sarah Mackay of Liberty Mutual and to Fina Fatty’s Filevine project address. In that message, Aaron acknowledged the Ohio accident and stated that the current medical bills totaled $7,135, noting he did not know whether any set-offs or discounts had been applied by the provider. He proposed a counteroffer of $12,000, stating that this amount would be inclusive of the total medical bills and pain and suffering, and asked whether they could get this resolved.

On July 21, 2025, Sarah Mackay replied to Aaron (and to the Filevine recipient). She thanked him for the email and for the counter demand of $12,000, noting that she had also left a voicemail and was following up by email. She stated that Liberty Mutual is unable to meet that amount but could extend an offer of $3,195 to resolve the matter. She asked Aaron to review the offer with his client and to advise Liberty Mutual of the client’s position.

Later on July 21, 2025, at 2:53:47 PM (GMT-04:00), Aaron Whaley sent a follow-up reply thanking Liberty Mutual for the counter and requesting an explanation of the reasoning behind offering less than the medical bills.

Notes accompanying the messages indicate the case metadata: Claim-Number 058373025, Exposure-Number 06, and that the correspondence was categorized as a Manual Outbound E-Mail with a template ID of BIFREEFORM. Liberty Mutual’s policy is underwritten by Liberty Mutual Personal Insurance Company. The reply from Sarah Mackay includes her title (Casualty Claims Resolution Specialist II) and direct contact information, along with standard Liberty Mutual mailing addresses, and a confidentiality notice stating that the e-mail and any attachments are intended only for the named addressees and may contain legally privileged or confidential information; recipients who are not the intended recipients are prohibited from dissemination and should notify the sender and delete the message.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Fina-Fatty-MVA-11-05-2024. Client: Fina Fatty. The matter concerns Claim #058373025 (Exposure #06) under Liberty Mutual Personal Insurance Company, with the case being handled by Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm for the client, Fina Fatty. The communications were exchanged with Sarah Mackay, Casualty Claims Resolution Specialist II at Liberty Mutual, and included the Filevine project address for the client.

The negotiation began in mid-July 2025. On July 14, 2025, Aaron Whaley sent an external email to Sarah Mackay and the Fina Fatty Filevine address regarding Claim #058373025. He reminded that the accident was in Ohio and stated that the current medical bills totaled $7,135.00, though he did not know whether providers had applied any set-offs or discounts. He proposed a counteroffer of $12,000, describing it as inclusive of the total medical bills and pain and suffering, and asked whether the amount could be approved. He signed as the attorney for Whaley Law Firm, listing his Louisville, Kentucky contact information.

On July 21, 2025, at 1:54 PM, Whaley followed up with Mackay and the Filevine address, asking for an explanation of Liberty Mutual’s reasoning for offering less than the medical bills. Mackay replied later that day, at 2:34 PM, stating that Liberty Mutual could not meet the $12,000 figure. She advised an offer of $3,195 to resolve the matter and asked Whaley to review the offer with his client and convey their position.

Another exchange occurred later on July 25, 2025. At 8:16 PM, Mackay wrote that medical bills were inflated and that Liberty Mutual had reviewed them to determining what is usual and customary. She asked Aaron to review and respond. A short follow-up from Aaron occurred later that day: he sent a brief message, “Care to share that review?” and reaffirmed his firm’s contact details.

Throughout these communications, the Liberty Mutual communications included standard policy and contact information for Liberty Mutual or Safeco Claims, including mailing addresses for claim submissions and a confidentiality notice typical of such emails. The email thread reflects ongoing settlement discussions regarding Claim #058373025, with initial demand of $12,000 from the petitioner’s side, a counteroffer of $3,195 from Liberty Mutual, and subsequent scrutiny of the medical bills’ reasonableness by Liberty Mutual.
